chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker
Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincent E Faught was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
$500.00 cash bond to be applied. 
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
